page.title: 13LANDSCAPE IN BURSCOUGH
page.content: The landscape between Burscough and Newburgh is one of the large flat fields separated by hedges and ditches. Drainage has always been a problem and the whole area needs constant attention to prevent flooding. Very few large trees exist as the area is regularly swept by strong westerly winds. Some of the oldest drainage ditches have been given names such as Ellerbrook and Blackbrook. Some of the farm buildings date back to approx. the 17th century but definite dating is difficult. Most of the buildings in Burscough are dated 1850 onwards following the construction of the canal and railway systems.
